intro: Selago hoepfneri, commonly known as the Cape golden saxifrage, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its dense, mat-forming growth habit and produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Its leaves are fleshy and succulent, adapted to store water in its arid native habitat. Selago hoepfneri is often cultivated in rock gardens and dry landscapes due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
